title: In Kyle Rittenhouse Trial, Defense Makes New Move for a Mistrial
sub_head: Attorneys say they received a compressed copy of a key video from the prosecution
body:
Lawyers for Kyle Rittenhouse, the teenager who shot and killed two people during unrest in Kenosha, Wis., last year, have made a new motion for a mistrial over a video they say was transferred to them by the prosecution at a lower resolution than what was available to the state.
The motion for a mistrial without prejudice—which if granted would allow for a retrial of the teenager—came during the jury’s second day of deliberations.
